entry.title: U.S. Handling of Mujahedin-E-Khalq Since U.S. Invasion of Iraq Is Examined

link.title: MG-871 | The Mujahedin-e Khalq in Iraq: A Policy Conundrum

entry.summary: At the beginning of Operation Iraqi Freedom, Coalition forces classified the Mujahedin-e Khalq, a militant organization from Iran with cult-like elements that advocates the overthrow of Iran's current government, as an enemy force. A new study looks at how coalition forces handled this group following the invasion.
